content.description: Vigilante Justice is an aesthetic wide crack in a gradually widening chimney. An ascent can be made harder or easier depending on how much stemming is done versus the use of offwidth techniques in the crack itself.
content.protection: Big cams (or Big Bros) are the only game in town. A single BD #6 and one or two BD #5s work well. There is a bolted anchor at the top.
content.location:
This route is deep in the Hallway. Enter at

The Convict

, and follow the Hallway to where it takes a 90 degree turn to the right. Proceed through the tight slot, and then take the first left into another corridor that is too narrow to reach the bottom of. Chimney though it above the floor where it is wide enough to fit in, and when it opens up enough to stand in comfortably, you'll see a striking #6 crack in the right wall.

Another way to access the start of this route is to climb

Sweet Nothings

or

Turd Launcher

in Corridor 1 and then rappel directly into the Hallway, landing just an easy 5 second stroll from the base of the route. The

Sweet Nothings

anchor is slightly more convenient for this purpose. The Orenczak/Lynn guide recommends approaching via

Turd Launcher

, but if I were to do it again, I'd opt for the Hallway adventure.

content.description:
Tape up because a twisted mind created this one. Heinous hands (a vertical garden of sharp feldspar crystals are inside the crack), a couple of stacks plus handjams (some flared off hands) and strong abs will get you... up or down, whichever occurs first! Belay on gear or a new rap station above the route (approximately 65').

Descend using an anchor set placed near the top of the route (as seen in Figure 2), as well as the anchors atop 'The Uncertainty Principle' are easiest.
content.protection: Take a half rack supplemented with additional medium cams up to #3 1/2 (Camalots or equivalent).
content.location:
Twisted is on the west face of the formation. It is Route #10 in the figure whereas

Malicious

is #11.

content.description:
This is located in the 'Confusion Alcove' (find C on Figures 1 and 2, also see photos). *Please note: If you're up for a fascinating multi-grade climb, this is it. The grade varies from 10c to 5.7!

Begin with a squeaky thin, hard start (crux), continue up and right through a vertical tunnel (5.9 to 5.8), and finish up the South Wing on a perfectly protected lieback (5.7) with lots of nubbins for 'feet'.

Belay and descend (approximately 60') from two ring anchors at top.
content.protection: Take along a full rack, being sure to have the three smallest RPs (or equivalents) and a '00' cam.  There are two ring anchors at the top.
content.location: This is in the Confusion Alcove (C) on the West Face.  See Figures 1 and 2 for location of 'C'.  Also see two accompanying photos.

content.description: Turd Launcher ascends a low angle chimney with a crack in the back.  Climb the chimney and crack to the bolted anchor.
content.protection: Small wires work well in the right crack toward the back of the chimney.  Bring a larger cam for the top of the crack.
content.location: It is inside Corridor 1.

content.description: Sweet Nothings ascends a left-leaning hand crack (about 5.6) to a slabby arete.  The arete is easier if you stem out to the wall behind.  There is a bolted anchor.
content.protection: Mostly hand sized pieces (#0.75 to 2) and a couple of small wires for the section before the arete.
content.location: It is inside Corridor 1.

climbs.name: Stepford Wives
climbs.fa: Rachael Lynn and Zach Orenczak, September 2008

content.description: Climb a hand crack to where it tops out and merges with a slab.  Continue up to the 2 bolt anchor atop Christie's Ultimatum.
content.protection: Cams ranging from 0.75 to a #2 and a couple of small wires.
content.location: This is on the east side.

content.description: If you enter the corridor from the area near Befuddled and The convict, this is the second route you reach.  If you enter from the other side, the first route you reach is Short Stuff, marked by the bolts on top and a crack on the opposite side of the wall.  Jam, stem, and chimney your way to the anchor.
content.protection: Medium to large cams and nuts.
content.location: It is inside the hanging corridor.

climbs.name: The Shocker
climbs.fa: Zach Orenczak and Mark Roberts, September 2008

content.description:
To quote Zach Orenczak and Rachael Lynn's

The Voo

: "Short, wide, and nasty".
content.protection: Trad to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location:
This is the crack shaped like an hourglass to the left of the chimney that leads to

Tuber's Birth Canal

.

content.description:
This climbs up the South face of the Maze formation ending at the southern rap bolts.

P1. Climb any system up to a big, comfy ledge. This is 25 feet left of

Stepford Wives

crack on the most southern piece of rock. The direct south face is broken crack systems leading to an 'easy' offwidth section to gain the ledge. If starting from the southwest corner of The Maze, head up near a small/mid-sized aspen. Climb the easy slab, and gain a crack to get up to the ledge.

P2. Climb the short and curved slightly overhanging buldge of handcrack. This is easier than it sounds as there is a sloping ramp just left of this crack that you can stem to until about halfway up where you have to then fully commit to the crack.

There is a 2 bolt anchor up top.
content.protection: A standard single rack, bring some wide stuff 5-6 for the belay (optional), 0.5, 0.75 (2), #1 (2).
content.location:
This is 25 feet left of

Stepford Wives

crack on the most southern piece of rock. Party hard.

content.description:
The box cracked and created a highly varied and entertaining climb, but first  you've got to get inside the box to find it. See photo 'entrance to Hallway A'.

Locate the entrance to Hallway A (Also shown on both Figs 1 and 2), downclimb about 8 feet to the 'floor', and head eastward in the corridor.  You'll see something like the photo (minus the climber) straight ahead.  Start up towards the blue sky about 55' above, negotiating 2 consecutive small roofs, top out, and belay on gear.

The descent is from any of the anchor sets placed on top of the formation.
content.protection: Take along full rack (belay on gear).
content.location: It is inside Hallway A (red #2)... see Number 2 on Figures 1 and 2.

content.description:
Not Long Enough is a fun little crack, although as the name suggests it's quite short. It consists of mostly comfortable hands but has a tight section in the middle and a #4 topout.

Per Skip Harper: Most seem to start the climb from the top of the convenient block adjacent to the climb on the left. However, if the climb is started from the very bottom, you are faced with a great, overhanging roof. Doing it this way raises the grade to at least 5.10a.
content.protection: A single set of cams to BD #4 is sufficient, but double #2 & #3 will sew it up. There is a bolted anchor at the top which is shared with Finger Snatcher, the 5.11 finger crack to the right.
content.location:
This route is deep in the Hallway. Enter by

The Convict

, and continue down the Hallway until it takes a 90 degree turn to the right. Proceed through a somewhat tight slot, and when it opens up, you'll see a hand crack with a roof near the start on the right side. The crack actually begins as an offwidth, but the climb starts on a boulder wedged in the Hallway and avoids this part.

content.description:
Starting from the same spot as

Sweet Nothings

, Nancy follows the left-facing, wide corner, the crack shuts to 0.5 size after twenty feet, then quickly opens back up to 5 size, over a boulder, then finishes at the

Turd Launcher

anchors.

This is a short but enjoyable climb with a couple of opportunities for good stacks.
content.protection: Rack up to a #5 and medium stoppers to avoid the rope being pinched going over the boulder.
content.location:
It is in corridor 1 in between

Sweet Nothings

and

Turd Launcher

.

content.description:
This is a straightforward and fairy well-protected chimney that's more fun than it looks and tops out on the summit of The Maze. There are good cracks inside the chimney for protection as well as a bomber #2 horizontal on the left partway up. Be forewarned: we had to tiptoe through some bird crap below an old abandoned nest halfway up the route.

To descend from the top, scramble down to the bolted anchor to climber's right of the chimney. This is the top anchor for

Flake Toprope

, an unprotected 10d slab problem.
content.protection: The chimney is quite well-protected as chimneys go. A single set of cams size 0.5 to 3 should be sufficient. There is a nice spot for a #4 or (better yet) a #5 halfway up. So if you have one along, you might as well use it.
content.location:
Mr. Pickles Learns to Swim is in the area known as Corridor 1. It's the obvious chimney system in the corner left of

Turd Launcher

and

Sweet Nothings

.

content.description:
Inside the corridor, there is a narrow elevator shaft with cracks in both corners of the back of the shaft. Jam and chimney your way up the shaft to where the right crack rounds outwards. Continue up and out of the shaft. You can set an anchor right above the shaft or continue to the bolts atop Befuddled. Rap from the top of

Befuddled

.
content.protection: There is ample protection in both cracks. I used the right crack and set medium to large stoppers and hexes, and a #4 C4.
content.location: It is inside the corridor.

content.description:
Malicious is 10c/d. As with

Twisted

, you sure don't have to look for friction to lock in your jams. There are feldspar 'teeth' inside. Unlike

Twisted

, however, Malicious is a very stout offwidth, challenging at the grade and varying only slightly in width. Take a few larger cams from #3 to #5, and there is a new rap station up top to get you down.
content.protection: Take larger gear, mainly #3 to #5 cams.

content.description: This short offwidth makes for a good warm-up. There is a short handcrack right next to it which offers an easy 5th Class downclimb. As of June 2020, there is some webbing and cord on the summit horn.
content.protection: A few larger cams.
content.location:
This route is on the SE corner of The Maze, 50 feet from the start of

Stepford Wives

.

content.description: This is the big crack splitting the east face (#1 on FIGURES 1 & 2), going from a body squeezing start to offwidth to hands.  It's smooth 'in there' at the start, so either wear a non-skid rubber suit or be ready to exert extra pressure against the opposing faces. Higher up, one must transition out of the fat crack and into a great hand crack.  Belay and descend (about 60 feet) from two ring anchors at the top.
content.protection: Take a half rack, doubles in the medium range, and at least 2 #5 Big Bros or equivalent large cams (cams probably preferable ,  we also used the two largest 'Big Dudes' at the time - it flares!) for the beginning (negotiating this area might be the crux, or maybe  higher up where the crack spits you out). (There are anchors at the top).
content.location: It is the East Face of the formation. See the Figs. 1 and 2 for the location of route #1, the climb, and top anchors.

content.description:
This is a thin, unprotected slab problem with a bolted top anchor for toprope use. It's good mileage for anyone who could use more Vedauwoo slab confidence and/or skill. There is an interesting and tricky bulge midway up, but the real crux felt like the top few feet where the slab gets very thin.

To access the top anchor, climb

Mr. Pickles Learns to Swim

, the 5.6 chimney in the corner left of the slab.
content.protection: Toprope only from the bolted anchor.
content.location:
This route is in Corridor 1. Look for a steep slab with obvious top anchor right of

Mr. Pickles Learns to Swim

and left of

Sweet Nothings

.

content.description: Climb through a short, vertical hands section then into fists/OW. Where the crack widens, you can move left onto the small, featured slab for the last few feet.
content.protection: A singles rack #1-4 with an optional #5. The anchor is a threaded pinch where the crack ends at a ledge.
content.location:
On the left side of the south face, around the corner 100 yards SW from

Stepford Wives

, it’s the leftmost of three cracks (the other are L->R On The Other Side, and All Mixed Up).

climbs.name: Cosmic Quarantine
climbs.fa: Zach Orenczak, Rachel Lynn, and Sam Trautman (Fall 2008)

content.description:
This is another bolted chimney climb similar to "

The Convict

", but there are several more obvious face holds to supplement the wider chimney.
content.protection: 6 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location:
This is the route directly to the left of "

The Convict

" located down in the corridor.

climbs.name: The Convict
climbs.fa: Sam Trautman, Rachel Lynn, and Zach Orenczak, 2008

content.description: The Convict is a wide chimney.  Enter from the top of a rock.  You may be able to reach the first bolt before starting, which would keep you from falling down into the chimney.  It starts as a back and foot chimney that progressively widens to wild stemming at the top.
content.protection:
7 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor.

Per

Zach Lau

: the hanger on the 1st bolt is missing.
content.location: This is on the southwest side of The Maze.

climbs.name: Conjugal Visit
climbs.fa: Mark Roberts, Rachael Lynn and Zach Orenczak, September 2008

content.description: This is a short climb. Expect laybacking, some offwidth, fists, and hands. The crux is the offwidth moves above the horizontal to the hands that lead to the top.
content.protection: Big stuff in the 4" to 5" inch range, maybe a hand-sized piece at the top.
content.location:
Conjugal Visit is 10' to the right of

The Convict

.

climbs.name: Christie's Ultimatum
climbs.fa: Mark Robberts and Zach Orenczak, Sept. 2008

content.description: This is a short and burly squeeze to fist stacks for 20 feet or so. The difficulty eases up substantially after pulling up onto a small ledge. It gets 12a in the guidebook, but is much easier.
content.protection:
This protects with a #6 Camalot at the bottom and narrows towards the top. There are bolted anchors at the top that can also be accessed by climbing "

Stepford Wives

".
content.location:
This is the obvious offwidth opposite from

Sweet Nothings

in the corridor.

content.description:
Befuddled is hands to offwidth in size. I unfortunately forgot my tape gloves, so I did not climb this route. I should have taped up for

Conjugal Visit

.

Per

Todd R

: most of it (maybe all of it) is climbable with only hand and fist jams (and I have small hands.) If you're in the area, definitely climb it! It's great. Pretty sustained, but maybe only one or two true offwidth moves are necessary.
content.protection: Trad to a 2 bolt anchor at the top.
content.location:
This is located between the corridor that leads to

Tuber's Birth Canal

and the chimney that contains

The Convict

and Cosmic Quarantine (5.8+).
